page.title: 01MOORLAND LANDSCAPE
page.content: Most of the land in our blocks is moorland.However,its cheif characteristic is a deep gorge separates the two main communities : the one to the north being Clydach and to the south Llanelly Hill.The area is well known for its old ironworkings and there are many tramroads near to our school.The ironworks are now not used but were important at the end of the 18th century and early in the 19th century.There is also a disused railway that once travelled from Abergavenny to Merthyr Tydfil. We have an important beechwood near our school with some ancient trees in it,a waterworks which pumps water from the river in the gorge to Brynmawr,a sewage works,and the Heads of the Valleys Trunk Roads. It is a family sparsely populated area.
